data.title: Lisa Marie Macci, P.A.
data.meta_description: Lisa Marie Macci, P.A. in Boca Raton, FL is a professional divorce attorney with over three decades of experience, (561) 361-8528.
data.text:
Lisa Marie Macci is a licensed attorney in four jurisdictions: Florida, Pennsylvania, New Jersey and Washington DC. Lisa is also a member of the U.S. Court of Appeals, Eleventh Circuit, the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Florida, the U.S. District Court for the District of New Jersey, and the U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Pennsylvania. She has been practicing law since 1988. Lisa is a graduate of Pepperdine University School of Law (Malibu, California) where she was privileged to have studied with the late Chief Justice William Rehnquist. She also attended Penn State University where she received a Bachelor's degree in Political Science. Prior to entering private practice, Lisa worked as outside counsel to the Trump Organization handling legal issues relating to its Atlantic City casinos, hotels, and the Trump Princess yacht. Lisa also worked as a Municipal Court Prosecutor, and as in-house corporate counsel to Tropicana Casino in Atlantic City. Currently, Ms. Macci's practice includes family, civil, and constitutional law, litigation and appeals.

Lisa has served on numerous arbitration panels including for FINRA and the Florida Lemon Law program. She has served as a Special Magistrate and Hearing Officer for various governmental entities in the areas of Contractor Licensing, Environmental Protection, Code Enforcement, Value Adjustment Board and Child Care Licensing and Enforcement. Lisa has also presented a number of legal seminars to other attorneys in the areas of Family Law and Real Estate and has also won precedent setting appellate decisions in the Third and Fourth District Courts of Appeal. She has served on the editorial board of the Florida Bar Journal and on the editorial board of several family law publications. Lisa has received Florida Bar Certified Arbitration Training - through the Florida Dispute Resolution Center, Grievance Mediation Training, and Family Mediation Training. She is a member of the South Palm Beach County Bar Association, the National Italian American Bar Association, and the Federalist Society.

In addition to the foregoing, Lisa has written articles and has spoken to numerous groups on family law and family court reform.

Lisa has served on the Board of Trustees for the Florida Philharmonic. She also was a Member of the Boca Raton Chamber of Commerce for many years and was a graduate of the Leadership Class 2001. She is also a member of the Chaine des Rotisseurs, and a member and volunteer of Spanish River Christian Church in Boca Raton, Florida.

Lisa's career as an attorney, activist, public speaker and radio personality illustrates the dynamic passion she has for complex issues. From talk-shows to the courtroom, Lisa Macci has demonstrated she has the integrity and intelligence to uncover the true story and let justice be served. Lisa is the Host of The Justice Hour radio show. In 2007, The Justice Hour was the Recipient of an Award in Radio/Public Affairs - "For excellence in reporting that highlights the system of law and justice as it affects the people of Florida" - 52nd Annual Florida Bar Media Awards. Lisa has also appeared on C-Span, Sky News, Countyline TV WBEC TV (BECON TV), and on several episodes of ABC's Parenting in the 90's.
